Name: Fog Cutter
Ingredients: 45 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
10 ml BarSol Mosto Verde Italia Pisco
15 ml Lustau Oloroso Don Nuño Sherry
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Collins glass .
STRAIN into glass filled with crushed ice.
Review: Don't be fooled by this seemingly innocuous orange-yellow long, fruity cocktail. It packs a serious punch with sweet almond notes masking its rum, gin and brandy.
History: A Tiki classic credited to Victor Bergeron . It appears in his 1972 Trader Vic's Bartender's Guide (revised edition) accompanied by his "TV" logo signifying that this is a Trader Vig signature cocktail. Above the recipe, he remarks, " Fog Cutter, hell. After two of these, you won't even see the stuff. "
Nutrition: One serving of Fog Cutter contains 258 calories
